title: Emmet's Reading Feed
description: Articles, tweets, and content processed from Things inbox

items.title: As Rocks May Think
items.content_text: Eric Jang describes using Claude as an automated scientist, discovering that coding agents can formulate theories, run experiments, and reflect on results. Traces the evolution of LLM reasoning from chain-of-thought to DeepSeek R1-Zero's breakthrough, and predicts astronomical demand for inference compute as automated research becomes standard.

items.title: summarize ‚Äî CLI + Chrome Side Panel for fast summaries
items.content_text: A CLI tool and Chrome Side Panel for fast summaries of URLs, PDFs, videos, and podcasts. Supports multiple LLM providers with a real extraction pipeline using Readability, markitdown, and Firecrawl fallback.

items.title: Grainrad
items.content_text: A free WebGPU-powered browser tool delivering ASCII art, dithering, and retro visual effects at 60fps. No installation required ‚Äî runs entirely in the browser.

items.title: Grainrad
items.content_text: A free WebGPU-powered browser tool delivering ASCII art, dithering, and retro visual effects at 60fps. Duplicate entry ‚Äî same as above.

items.title: Leva | Three.js Resources
items.content_text: A React GUI library for creating intuitive real-time controls in Three.js projects. Supports numbers, booleans, vectors, and colors with minimal setup and live updates.

items.title: Space Type Generator
items.content_text: A kinetic typography generator by Kielm. Interactive web tool for creating animated type compositions.

items.title: Public Work by Cosmos
items.content_text: A search engine for public domain content ‚Äî explore 100,000+ copyright-free images from The MET, New York Public Library, and other sources.

items.title: Dive ‚Äî Introducing the AI Systems Designer
items.content_text: On the emerging role of AI systems designer ‚Äî prototyping AI features, establishing guardrails for dynamic interfaces, and empowering AI to use design systems. Features interview with Jordan Singer at Figma.

items.title: Open Design Docs
items.content_text: Resources for building great design teams: leadership blueprints, level competency frameworks for career progression, and AI-powered performance review tools.

items.title: OGimage.gallery
items.content_text: A curated gallery of hand-picked Open Graph images from companies like Stripe, Shopify, Figma, Intercom, and more. Useful design reference for social media preview cards.

items.title: It's Time To Build AI | UX
items.content_text: A showcase of AI/UX demo projects from the first AI|UX event, featuring mindmapping canvases, AI writing apps, generative UI plugins, and AI Zettelkasten ‚Äî all exploring interaction paradigms beyond chatbots.

items.title: Who are we talking to when we talk to these bots?
items.content_text: Colin Fraser argues ChatGPT is actually three things: a language model, a chat interface that manipulates user behavior, and a fictional character. The chat window creates such a powerful illusion that even jailbreakers remain trapped in conversation mode.

items.title: Curious Beginner's Guide to LLMs
items.content_text: An accessible overview of how LLMs work: next-word prediction at core, pretraining and fine-tuning as two stages. Covers tool use, RAG, multimodal capabilities, and System 1 vs System 2 thinking.

items.title: Notes on Existential Risk from Artificial Superintelligence
items.content_text: Michael Nielsen's exploration of whether superintelligence poses existential risk. Identifies three paradoxes making the risk hard to argue about, the alignment dilemma, and whether recipes for ruin exist that ASI could discover.

items.title: Something Pretty Right: A History of Visual Basic
items.content_text: The story of Visual Basic from Alan Cooper's Ruby prototype through explosive growth to the fatal VB.NET rewrite. At its peak, two-thirds of Windows business apps used VB with 3.5M developers.

items.title: Blogroll ‚Äì Brendan Schlagel
items.content_text: A curated list of interesting people on the internet ‚Äî writers, makers, and thinkers ‚Äî including Bret Victor, Craig Mod, Frank Chimero, Kevin Kelly, Robin Sloan, and many more.

items.title: End-user Programming
items.content_text: Ink & Switch explores why software users can't customize their tools. Proposes three qualities: embodiment, living systems, and in-place toolchains. Five experiments reveal promising approaches including typed data pipelines and computation-as-bots.

items.title: Capturing and Colliding
items.content_text: Steven Johnson on the tradition of commonplace books ‚Äî personal archives of quotes and ideas dating back to Milton and Locke. Traces his journey from HyperCard to digital note-taking, arguing reading and writing are inseparable.

items.title: modest
items.content_text: Molly Mielke's curated collection of recommended articles, films, songs, and media. Highlights include pieces on hiring, the importance of awe, and Work on Something that Matters.

items.title: @delba_oliveira: Audio hooks for Claude Code
items.content_text: Set up audio hooks that trigger childhood game sounds when Claude completes a task or requires permission. Prevents constantly checking back on long-running tasks.

items.title: @chongdashu: Point-and-click adventure game
items.content_text: A walkable point-and-click adventure game with navigation mesh, item hotspots, and AI-generated animated backgrounds. Built using GPT 5.2 and Codex 5.3.

items.title: @meetgranola: Hello MCP
items.content_text: Granola announces MCP integration.

items.title: @chongdashu: 3D vibe coding pipeline
items.content_text: 3D character creation pipeline: nano banana pro for characters, meshy for rigging, GLB export, Three.js rendering, Capacitor.js for native iOS. GPT 5.3 codex for code generation.

items.title: @geoffreylitt: Is software dead? (4-part series)
items.content_text: Geoffrey Litt's 4-part blog series on malleable software in the age of LLMs ‚Äî why GUIs still matter and how spreadsheets illuminate the path forward.

items.title: @remotion: Prompt collection
items.content_text: Remotion launched a community-driven collection of prompts for video creation in React.

items.title: @levelsio: Design appreciation
items.content_text: Levelsio praising a project's design and domain name.

items.title: @soulegit: Blue noise dither animation
items.content_text: Technique for adding motion to static dither graphics by layering Blue Noise underneath ASCII dither for a shimmer effect.

items.title: @andrewyng: Claude Skills course
items.content_text: Andrew Ng course on building custom Claude skills. Skills are portable across Claude.ai, Claude Code, API, and Agent SDK.

items.title: @emollick: Sierra-style adventure game by Claude
items.content_text: Claude Code designed, tested, and built a complete Sierra-style adventure game with EGA graphics and text parser.

items.title: @minchoi: Blender MCP
items.content_text: Link to the Blender MCP repo for connecting Blender to AI models via MCP.

items.title: @thedankoe: High-density content creation
items.content_text: In a world flooded with AI noise, build an idea museum from curated sources, write the same idea 1,000 ways, and create systems-as-products.

items.title: @bcherny: Claude Code verification tip
items.content_text: Give Claude a way to verify its work ‚Äî feedback loops 2-3x the quality of results.

items.title: @scottbelsky: 4 P's of AI adoption
items.content_text: Framework for AI adoption: Play (access without expectations), Pilot (one project the new way), Protect (learning KPIs), Provoke (invite tough questions).

items.title: @andy_matuschak: Mother of All Demos performance
items.content_text: A live electronica-infused performance of the Mother of All Demos at Stanford in 2015.

items.title: @kracov: Dock
items.content_text: Dock ‚Äî a collaboration platform for working with people outside your company.

items.title: @SwiftOnSecurity: In product support
items.content_text: Joke about Google's billion-dollar AI failing to detect something obvious.

items.title: @kellianderson: Richard McGuire's Here
items.content_text: Reference to Richard McGuire's 'Here' with a linked example.

items.title: last30days-skill
items.content_text: Claude Code skill that researches any topic across Reddit, X, YouTube and the web from the past 30 days, then generates copy-paste-ready prompts based on what communities are discussing. Supports watchlists and cron scheduling.

items.title: Elements of Style
items.content_text: A Claude Code skill by Jesse Vincent that enforces Strunk & White writing principles ‚Äî clarity, concision, and active voice ‚Äî as an automated editing pass on your writing.

items.title: Chris Glass's Blogroll
items.content_text: A curated collection of personal and independent websites celebrating the non-corporate internet, organized alphabetically with brief descriptions of what makes each worth visiting.

items.title: Playground AI
items.content_text: AI image generation platform for creating and editing images with various aesthetic styles and models.

items.title: From the Weeds to the Board Room
items.content_text: Peter Merholz on how design leaders must shift from managing down (craft, team) to managing up and out (business strategy, cross-functional influence) as they advance to VP/C-level.

items.title:
@dani_avila7: ### WebGPU-Powered Retro Graphics Tool

Grainrad is a free w‚Ä¶
items.content_text:
### WebGPU-Powered Retro Graphics Tool

Grainrad is a free web-based tool that delivers ASCII art, dithering, and retro visual effects running at 60 frames per second. The application leverages WebGPU technology to provide hardware-accelerated performance directly in the browser without requiring downloads or installations.

### Real-Time Performance and Accessibility

The tool processes visual effects in real-time at a consistent 60fps framerate, making it suitable for both static image process
